title: Nitro forges ahead with listing, pitches subscription revenue
text:
Nitro Software Ltd is out to prove the initial public offering market – and the way floats are marketed to potential investors – isn't busted.

Morgan Stanley launched Nitro's run at the ASX boards on Monday, telling clients the company was worth as much as $555 million based on the expected value of its future cash flows.

Nitro co-founder Sam Chandler. Stefan Postles

Nitro's pitch is all subscription revenue. Morgan Stanley analysts reckon subscription revenue will account for more than half of Nitro's revenue in the 2020 financial year, which is up from only 11 per cent in 2017.

And it has had considerable success retaining subscription customers, with renewal rates at 91 per cent in the first half of this year.

That recurring revenue is the sort of thing fund managers will pay 10-times revenue for – and it is why Morgan Stanley's analysts put a 6.8-times to 9.5-times revenue multiple on the business.
description: Nitro Software is out to prove the IPO market – and the way floats are marketed to potential investors – isn't busted.
